thread.title: 'World's first transgender parent and child' go from mum and son to dad and daughter - The Sun
thread.title_full: 'World's first transgender parent and child' go from mum and son to dad and daughter - The Sun

title: 'World's first transgender parent and child' go from mum and son to dad and daughter - The Sun
text:
'I finally felt free' ‘World’s first transgender parent and child’ go from mum and son to dad and daughter 
Corey House first said she was transgender when she was 11 and now her mum Erica, now known as Eric, is also transitioning By BECKY PEMBERTON AND NEWS.COM.AU 19th January 2017, 2:35 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ERIC and Corey House share a bond like no other parent and their child: they’re both transgender. 
Corey, 14, was born a boy but four years ago she told her mother she was transgender. A photo posted by Corey Maison (@coreymaison) on Jan 13, 2017 at 4:48am PST Eric House Corey House first told her parents she was transgender four years ago Array Following Corey’s confession, last year her mother Erica revealed she was also transgender and now goes by the name Eric Facebook 10 Eric (formerly Erica), centre, and his daughter Corey, right, who are believed to be the world’s first parent and child to publicly come out as transgender 
Then last year Corey’s mother, Erica, revealed she was also transgender and now goes by the name Eric. 
They are believed to be the world’s first parent and child to publicly come out as transgender and transitioning. 
Speaking on This Morning today, Corey said she realised there had been a gender mix-up when she was seven or eight. 
She spoke of how lucky she was to have been encouraged along her journey by her family. 'World's first transgender dad and daughter' talk about their transition Eric House Corey said she was bullied growing up for being “overly feminine” Eric House 10 Corey now has nearly 60,000 followers on her public Facebook page who follow her journey A photo posted by Corey Maison (@coreymaison) on Mar 8, 2016 at 4:07pm PST Eric House The dad and daughter duo say they have been given incredible support by their family Array Erica (second from right) told husband Les first that she was transgender and wanted to live as a man, and then broke the news to her children Chelsea, 22, Kailee, 14, Corey, Ellen, eight, Willow, six, and four-year-old Savanna 
She said: "It was amazing because a lot of kids don't have support from their parents." 
Before Corey could start physically transitioning, she underwent a three-year process with therapists who helped her with the social aspects. 
"It was very long," she commented. "They did counselling and a lot of things to make sure I was ready for the transition to actually start." 
Eric, a dad-of-six, told the Mirror Newspaper he realised he was “born in the wrong body” at the same time as his daughter but kept it a secret while Corey transitioned into a girl. Facebook Corey said before she could start physically transitioning, there was a three-year process with therapists Eric House 10 Eric said that his relationship with husband Les has strengthened since the transition 
He told his husband Les first and the rest of the family later including children Chelsea, 22, Kailee, 14, Corey, Ellen, eight, Willow, six, and four-year-old Savanna. 
Speaking to the Mirror Online , Eric said Les was incredibly supportive. 
“It was an awful secret to keep from my family,” he said. 
“My loved ones were awesome, almost like nothing really changed. My husband has been supportive through everything. 
“Our relationship is actually stronger and better than it ever has been in the 10 years we’ve been together.” Eric House 10 Corey (right) and Eric (left) hope their story inspires others who feel the same A photo posted by Corey Maison (@coreymaison) on Dec 28, 2016 at 5:29pm PST 
Corey was bullied growing up for being “overly feminine”. But the support of her family helped her through the tough times. 
“They didn’t really react since I’m still who I’ve always been,” she said. 
“The only thing that was different was that I started wearing girls’ clothes outside of the house. 
“I finally felt free once my family knew.” Related Articles NAME SHAME Now kids as young as seven are taught to stop using terms 'boys' and 'girls' to be fair to transgender pupils 'SHAME IS A POWERFUL EMOTION' UK's first transgender headteacher reveals her struggle feeling like an 'impostor' all her life school sir's a hit as miss UK's first transgender headteacher returns to work and hopes to be role model for trans students Changing times Who is India Willoughby? Britain's first transgender newsreader - here's what we know 'IN MY MIND I WAS ALWAYS A GIRL' Transgender model doesn't tell the men she dates about her past because she says it 'isn't relevant' 
Corey has nearly 60,000 followers on her public Facebook page. 
She said told the Mirror Online she’s “happy” that her story inspires people. 
“I want to tell anyone out there who is trans to find someone you can talk to. Find someone who won’t judge you that you can go to if you need a friend," she commented. 
We previously shared how kids as young as seven are taught to stop using terms ‘boys’ and ‘girls’ to be fair to transgender pupils, and when the UK’s first transgender headteacher returned to work and hoped to be role model for trans students. Fury as BBC broadcasts transgender show for children
